original_title: Cabinet grants ‘approved Enterprise’ status to four import companies for re-export of selected spices
original_body_lines: Approval was granted at the cabinet meeting held on 18-12-2023 for the procedure to import and process the selected spices to reexport in the form of oil extract, oleoresin, and residue.
Import and export regulations No. 10 of 2024 have been imposed for that purpose. According to the aforementioned

regulations, several enterprises have already signed supplementary agreements with the Board of Investment of Sri Lanka to import and process selected spices. The Board of Investment of Sri Lanka has recommended the granting of “approved enterprise” status to these below mentioned enterprises.
Accordingly, the Cabinet of Ministers has agreed to the proposal presented by the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Planning, and Economic Development, to grant

“approved enterprise” status to the following enterprises that have fulfilled the requirements of the approved procedure for re-exporting selected spices in the form of oil extract, oleoresin, and residue.
Delimitation committee appointed to review the recommendations of the delimitation committee of the years 2012 and 2021
Declaration of Government Financial Performance for the second quarter of the year 2025 presented to Cabinet
